meanings.def: a person who works in another person’s house, and cooks, cleans, etc. for them
examples: They treat their mother like a servant.
servant to somebody She was working as a servant to the Smith family.
servant of somebody one of the servants of the king of Persia
The duchess arrived, surrounded by her army of servants.
The relationship was one of master and servant.
They went up another set of stairs to the servants' quarters.

meanings.def: a person who works for a company or an organization
examples: Mr Bennet said his client was a loyal servant to the council.

meanings.def: a person or thing that is controlled by something
examples: He was willing to make himself a servant of his art.

meanings.def: used to end a formal letter

idioms.def: used to end a formal letter
